title: >>> Mid-Season SLUMP
body_text:
Did You Know?
--> DODGEBALL TWENTY-SIX: 14 players ... DODGEBALL 36: 12 players ... DODGEBALL 45: 10 players
It's the Mid-Season Slump!
LVI Books
- Attendance: 11 (Second lowest ever behind DODGEBALL 45)
- Biggest Return: Jim Butler (Last played at D-DAY 5)
- New Players: 0
- DODGEBALL LVI used the WHS Front courts for the first time since the massive DODGEBALL 41 back in late May. LVI was the 20th Front court event as well.
- Due to the low attendance, Prison Ball returned with the surprising inclusion of garbage cans used for team regeneration.
- Only two females participated at DODGEBALL LVI: Alison Bertsch and Lindsay Gough. This ties the record first set at DODGEBALL 45.
- LVI debuted two new captains in Jim Butler and Lindsay Gough.
- Though he was on the poster, Derek Carty did not attend DODGEBALL LVI.
Butler vs. Gough
Right from the start, DODGEBALL LVI had shocked the world. A low attendance, a majority-vote to include both Prison Ball
and
garbage cans, and the announcement of two random captains.
For Jim Butler and Lindsay Gough, their dodgeball careers have been very quiet. It has nothing to do with their actual abilities, but rather the amount of times they have participated, or lack there of. Season 6 has truly be unpredictable and DODGEBALL LVI further proved that.
It will be known as an "East Side only" dodgeball event. Every win, with the exception of the finale game, came from the east side of the WHS tennis courts. In the end, it was Jim Butler who walked away victorious.
Jim Bulter defeated Lindsay Gough at DODGEBALL LVI: 4 - 2.
Down and Out: The Nutshot of DODGEBALL LVI
What an absolute beating Robert Brown took at DODGEBALL LVI. Perhaps no shot was as bad than that given to him from one of his own teammates!
Robert Brown had just caught a ball while in prison, allowing him to return to the game. But upon walking out of prison, he was met with a ball so full of force that several homes in the neighborhood could have heard. It was thrown by the powerful Kevin Megill and actually aimed for Robert's brother, Matt [who was imprisoned at the time]. But the ball made a surprising right turn, sending the eldest Brown brother down and out for several minutes. The impactful shot left many laughing all the way home.
Schedule Reminder!
DODGEBALL 57 is Saturday, September 23 at WHS (6:30)
DODGEBALL 58 is Saturday, September 30 at WHS (6:30)
DODGEBALL 59/LIV is Friday, October 6 at WHS (6:30)
DODGEBALL LX is Saturday, October 14 at WHS (6:30)

Did You Know?
--> DODGEBALL TWENTY-SIX: 14 players ... DODGEBALL 36: 12 players ... DODGEBALL 45: 10 players

It's the Mid-Season Slump!

LVI Books
- Attendance: 11 (Second lowest ever behind DODGEBALL 45)
- Biggest Return: Jim Butler (Last played at D-DAY 5)
- New Players: 0
- DODGEBALL LVI used the WHS Front courts for the first time since the massive DODGEBALL 41 back in late May. LVI was the 20th Front court event as well.
- Due to the low attendance, Prison Ball returned with the surprising inclusion of garbage cans used for team regeneration.
- Only two females participated at DODGEBALL LVI: Alison Bertsch and Lindsay Gough. This ties the record first set at DODGEBALL 45.
- LVI debuted two new captains in Jim Butler and Lindsay Gough.
- Though he was on the poster, Derek Carty did not attend DODGEBALL LVI.


Butler vs. Gough
Right from the start, DODGEBALL LVI had shocked the world. A low attendance, a majority-vote to include both Prison Ball and garbage cans, and the announcement of two random captains.

For Jim Butler and Lindsay Gough, their dodgeball careers have been very quiet. It has nothing to do with their actual abilities, but rather the amount of times they have participated, or lack there of. Season 6 has truly be unpredictable and DODGEBALL LVI further proved that.

It will be known as an "East Side only" dodgeball event. Every win, with the exception of the finale game, came from the east side of the WHS tennis courts. In the end, it was Jim Butler who walked away victorious.

Jim Bulter defeated Lindsay Gough at DODGEBALL LVI: 4 - 2.


Down and Out: The Nutshot of DODGEBALL LVI
What an absolute beating Robert Brown took at DODGEBALL LVI. Perhaps no shot was as bad than that given to him from one of his own teammates!

Robert Brown had just caught a ball while in prison, allowing him to return to the game. But upon walking out of prison, he was met with a ball so full of force that several homes in the neighborhood could have heard. It was thrown by the powerful Kevin Megill and actually aimed for Robert's brother, Matt [who was imprisoned at the time]. But the ball made a surprising right turn, sending the eldest Brown brother down and out for several minutes. The impactful shot left many laughing all the way home.

Schedule Reminder!
DODGEBALL 57 is Saturday, September 23 at WHS (6:30)
DODGEBALL 58 is Saturday, September 30 at WHS (6:30)
DODGEBALL 59/LIV is Friday, October 6 at WHS (6:30)
DODGEBALL LX is Saturday, October 14 at WHS (6:30)
